com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface createDerivedOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface createDerivedOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createDerivedOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createDerivedOrder API is used to create derived orders from the product lines of an existing order.

    • Method Detail

      • createDerivedOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document createDerivedOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        The createDerivedOrder API is used to create derived orders from the product lines of an existing order. The createDerivedOrder API can also update an existing derived order, by adding the new lines to the existing derived order. The existing derived order must be identified by the determineDerivedOrderForConsolidation user exit. If the user exit is not implemented or if the user exit returns a null document, the createDerivedOrder API creates a new derived order.

        The OrderLine of the parent order will be referred to as parent line and OrderLine of the derived order, as derived line.

        A parent line can have multiple derived lines. Partial derivation is allowed. Deriving a order changes the status of the quantity in the parent line. If a parent line is part of multiple releases, each release corresponds to a different derived line.

        If it is not possible to derive lines from the parent order, no error is thrown.

        Parent lines which belong to the same order can be grouped to form more than one derived order. The grouping of parent lines is based on the DerivedOrderConsolidationTemplate, stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The DerivedOrderConsolidationTemplate contains only the OrderLine element and its child element Item. All the grouping attributes must be OrderLine and Item attributes. This template must be present and must contain at least an empty OrderLine element. If the template contains an empty OrderLine element, all the derived lines become part of one order. The DocumentType of the derived order is associated with a DerivedOrderConsolidationTemplate.

        The parent order and the derived order have the same Buyer Organization, Seller Organization and Enterprise. The DerivedOrderCreate transaction should be associated with a DERIVED_DOCUMENT_TYPE, which is stored in the YFS_TRANSACTION table. The value of the DERIVED_DOCUMENT_TYPE is used as the DocumentType of the derived order during creation.

        If a derived order is being created, the grouping attributes are input to createOrder as OrderHeader attributes of the derived order.

        The EarliestShipDates of all the parent lines in a group are examined, and the minimum EarliestShipDates is set as the ReqShipDates of the newly-created derived order. The same procedure is done for ReqDeliveryDate also. For ReqCancelDate minimum value of ReqCancelDate on parent lines is used to stamp on the order header. If the group of parent lines are being included in an existing derived order, the dates of the derived order cannot be modified by calling the CreateDerivedOrder API.

        A DefaultTemplateOrder may exists for the Buyer, Seller, Enterprise and TemplateOrderDocumentType combination for the derived order. If a DefaultTemplateOrder exists for the new derived order, the remaining header information is taken from this DefaultTemplateOrder, using the template CreateOrderDefaultTemplate, which is stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The CreateOrderDefaultTemplate is chosen from the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table based on the document type of the derived order. If the DefaultTemplateOrder is found but no CreateOrderDefaultTemplate is found, an error is thrown.

        If the DefaultTemplateOrder exists, and it has a value for any of these:
        PersonInfoBillTo, BillToId, and PersonInfoShipTo the value in the template is assigned to the derived order. If there is no value in the DefaultTemplateOrder, or there is no DefaultTemplateOrder, values are copied from the parent order.

        The DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate is stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. This template is chosen on the basis of the DocumentType of the derived order. The DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate is based on OrderLine, and should not default values for attributes that are keys, such as OrderLineKey, OrderLineScheduleKey. See the OrderLine element of the YFS_createOrder_input.xml. PersonInfoShipTo, ShipToID, PersonInfoMarkFor, SCAC, CarrierServiceCode, CarrierAccountNo, DeliveryCode and FreightTerms ( = FOB) , but the DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate has these attributes &/ or elements, then the information will be defaulted from the parent order header to the derived line(s).
        A line's Schedule attributes LotNumber and Quantity are propagated from the parent line to derived lines only if the Schedules element is present in the DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate.

        The derived lines are created with DerivedFromOrderHeaderKey, DerivedFromOrderLineKey and DerivedFromReleaseKey populated. The HoldFlag is defaulted to N on the derived lines.

        All inventory updates for a derived line are done only based on the derived order's document settings.

        The DerivedOrderCreate transaction, along with events, pickup and drop statuses is not provided in the factory setup. This transaction should be derived from the base transaction DERIVED_ORDER_CREATE. The DerivedOrderCreate transaction should have the pickup and drop statuses configured. The ON_SUCCESS event to be raised after calling the createDerivedOrder API should also be configured for the transaction.

        To work with fractional OrderedQty, set yfs.install.displaydoublequantity to Y in the yfs.properties file.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the user exits
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSDetermineDerivedOrderForConsolidationUE It also invokes all the user exits invoked by createOrder, if a new derived order is being created. It invokes all the user exits invoked by changeOrderif the group of parent lines are being included in an existing derived order.

        Events Raised: Event raised under the transaction passed by the user
        ON_SUCCESS This event is raised for the parent order upon successful execution of this api.
        If a new derived order is created, then all the events, raised by createOrder API, are raised for the newly created derived order under the transaction ORDER_CREATE. If a group of parent lines are included in an existing derived order, then all the events, raised by changeOrder API, are raised for this derived order under the transaction ORDER_CHANGE.
        Data published - YFS_DERIVED_ORDER_CREATE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
        Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Input Template Support:
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to input xml for element level details.
        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
        Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
        Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Input Template Support:
        Yes.

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits:
        Audit done only for an existing derived order if a group of parent lines is included in it by this API.

        Pre-conditions:
        The parent order must exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. However, some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the nodes except for the following:


          Reference

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML that contains details of the parent order as well as a list of the derived orders. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
